intro: Luehea tarapotina, commonly known as the Tepui luehea, is a flowering plant native to the tepuis of Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its restricted habitat, Luehea tarapotina is considered a rare and endangered species.
